comments.body: BTW, is this required to change? I think usual case in production is to work without specifying the temp dir.

Yes, this is only required for tests and if you check the test `SPARK-10878: test resolution files cleaned after resolving artifact` at the end, it checks whether the resolution files are cleaned at the end or not, but that use `tempIvyPath` whereas when we don't pass it here what happens is it picks user's .ivy location. This change is slightly separate as its just standardizes using `tempIvyPath` across the tests in this suite.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +80,84 @@  test("create additional resolvers") {
    val repos = "a/1,b/2,c/3"
    val settings = SparkSubmitUtils.buildIvySettings(Option(repos), Some(tempIvyPath))
    val resolver = settings.getDefaultResolver.asInstanceOf[ChainResolver]
    assert(resolver.getResolvers.size() === 4)
